title.value: conn2res: A toolbox for connectome-based reservoir computing
title.justification: This is the title of the paper.
title.quote: conn2res: A toolbox for connectome-based reservoir computing

extractions.description: This research paper introduces conn2res, an open-source Python toolbox designed to implement biological neural networks as artificial neural networks. The toolbox leverages reservoir computing to perform cognitive tasks and allows for the inclusion of different network architectures and dynamics.

type.justification: The paper presents an empirical toolbox (conn2res) for implementing biological neural networks as artificial neural networks and evaluates its performance on specific tasks using real datasets.
type.quote: Here we present conn2res: an open-source Python toolbox for implementing biological neural networks as artificial neural networks...

name.justification: The study primarily explores the intersection of connectomics and computational neuroscience, leveraging reservoir computing for neural network modeling.
name.quote: The connection patterns of neural circuits form a complex network. How signaling in these circuits manifests as complex cognition and adaptive behaviour remains the central question in neuroscience.

name.justification: The paper focuses extensively on the principles and applications of reservoir computing in neural network modeling.
name.quote: Reservoir computing is a versatile paradigm that uses nonlinear dynamics of high-dimensional dynamical systems to perform computations and approximate cognitive functions.

name.justification: The toolbox utilizes connectomes reconstructed from advanced neuroimaging techniques to inform reservoir architectures.
name.quote: The toolbox allows researchers to input connectomes reconstructed using multiple techniques...

name.justification: The toolbox also incorporates machine learning principles, particularly for training and evaluating the neural networks.
name.quote: In reservoir networks learning occurs only at the readout connections...

name.justification: The paper implements Echo-State Networks (ESNs) as part of the reservoir computing paradigm, particularly in the tutorial section.
name.quote: To do so, we implement an echo-state network [36] whose connections are constrained by a human connectome reconstructed from diffusion-weighted MRI data.

is_contributed.justification: The model is not a contribution of the paper but is used within the scope of the toolkit.
is_contributed.quote: To do so, we implement an echo-state network [36]...

is_executed.justification: The Echo-State Network is executed in the provided examples within the paper.
is_executed.quote: We implement an echo-state network [36] whose connections are constrained by a human connectome.

is_compared.justification: The Echo-State Network is not numerically compared to other models in the scope of the paper.
is_compared.quote: Results in Fig. 4 suggest that both local and global network dynamics have an impact on task performance.

referenced_paper_title.value: The “echo state” approach to analysing and training recurrent neural networks-with an erratum note
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper by H. Jaeger is cited as the reference for Echo-State Networks.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To do so, we implement an echo-state network [36]... [36] H. Jaeger, “The “echo state” approach...

name.justification: The dataset consists of connectome data reconstructed from diffusion-weighted MRI, used to constrain the reservoir's architecture.
name.quote: To do so, we implement an echo-state network [36] whose connections are constrained by a human connectome reconstructed from diffusion-weighted MRI data.

referenced_paper_title.value: The Human Connectome Project: A legacy for the future
referenced_paper_title.justification: The Human Connectome Project is a commonly referenced source for connectome datasets.

name.justification: NumPy is listed as one of the dependencies used in the development of the toolbox.
name.quote: The toolbox is built on top of the following well established, documented and maintained Python package dependencies: NumPy (https://numpy.org; [114–116])

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper 'Array programming with NumPy' is a foundational reference for NumPy.

name.justification: SciPy is also listed as one of the dependencies used in the development of the toolbox.
name.quote: The toolbox is built on top of the following well established, documented and maintained Python package dependencies: ... SciPy (https://scipy.org; [117])

referenced_paper_title.value: SciPy 1.0: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper 'SciPy 1.0: Fundamental algorithms for scientific computing in Python' is a foundational reference for SciPy.

name.justification: pandas is also used as a dependency in the toolbox.
name.quote: The toolbox is built on top of the following well established, documented and maintained Python package dependencies: .. pandas (https://pandas.pydata.org; [118]),

referenced_paper_title.value: Data structures for statistical computing in python
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper 'Data structures for statistical computing in python' is a foundational reference for pandas.

name.justification: Scikit-Learn is used for its machine learning capabilities in the toolbox's pipeline.
name.quote: The toolbox is built on top of the following well established, documented and maintained Python package dependencies: .. Scikit-Learn (https://scikit-learn.org; [119]),

referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper 'Scikit-learn: Machine learning in Python' is a foundational reference for Scikit-Learn.
